verses.verse: (For the choir director; upon an eight-stringed lyre. A Psalm of David.) Help, <WH3467> Lord, <WH3068> for the godly <WH2623> man <WH2623> ceases <WH1584> to be, For the faithful <WH539> disappear <WH6461> from among the sons <WH1121> of men. <WH120>
They speak <WH1696> falsehood <WH7723> to one <WH376> another; <WH7453> With flattering <WH9142> lips <WH8193> and with a double <WH3820> heart <WH3820> they speak. <WH1696>
May the Lord <WH3068> cut <WH3772> off <WH3772> all <WH3605> flattering <WH9142> lips, <WH8193> The tongue <WH3956> that speaks <WH1696> great <WH1419> things; <WH1419>
Who <WH834> have said, <WH559> "With our tongue <WH3956> we will prevail; <WH1396> Our lips <WH8193> are our own; who <WH4310> is lord <WH113> over us?"

"Because <WH4480> of the devastation <WH7701> of the afflicted, <WH6041> because <WH4480> of the groaning <WH603> of the needy, <WH34> Now <WH6258> I will arise, <WH6965>" says <WH559> the Lord; <WH3068> "I will set <WH7896> him in the safety <WH3468> for which he longs. <WH6315>"
The words <WH565> of the Lord <WH3068> are pure <WH2889> words; <WH565> As silver <WH3701> tried <WH6884> in a furnace <WH5948> on the earth, <WH776> refined <WH2212> seven <WH7659> times. <WH7659>
Thou, O Lord, <WH3068> wilt keep <WH8104> them; Thou wilt preserve <WH5341> him from this <WH2098> generation <WH1755> forever. <WH5769>
The wicked <WH7563> strut <WH1980> about on every <WH5439> side, <WH5439> When vileness <WH2149> is exalted <WH7311> among the sons <WH1121> of men. <WH120>
